attributes.action: Raise the minimum wage for health & social care workers to £10 per hour
attributes.additional_details: Some supermarket and hospitality workers, who undergo no training, earn more than carers. Without carers society cannot function. It takes a highly skilled person to administer medication, deal with severe dementia, to safely transfer disabled patients, and to change things like pain patches and catheter bags. The care sector has a huge turnaround and it is obvious why - too much giving when they receive hardly anything back. Scotland has raised carers wages (if only by 3%) so why not England?
attributes.background: We hear so much about NHS workers being valued and they should be. But health & social care workers who don't work for the NHS are not valued enough. Carers are considered as 'low skilled' but do extensive training and have a huge responsibility over peoples lives.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Pay all NHS Staff at least the Real Living Wage: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310615

Increase minimum wage for social care staff to £10.72: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/316909

Pay rise for NHS and care staff: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/313488
